page.title: 11ALICE INGHAM SCHOOL
page.content: Alice Ingham School was opened in Sept. 1974 to accomodate children from this area.When the school was built, nobody knew what to call it, until one day the priest said that they had a saint on their doorstep. She was called Alice Ingham.She had lived in Rochdale all her life so she was an obvious choice.Alice Ingham was born in 1830 and died in 1890 at the age of 60.During her life she had contributed in many ways to the parish and never tired of helping the community. Children start the school at the age of 5 and leave when they are 10.There are three classes in the Infants and three classes in the Juniors.When the school was built there was no library so they built their own. It is a small school but there is lots of area to play.
